title: CHLA-Z: Global gridded chlorophyll-a vertical distribution (0–200 m) with derived metrics
summary: CHLA-Z is a global gridded dataset providing estimates of chlorophyll-a concentration as a function of depth (0–200 m) on a latitude/longitude grid, along with derived vertical-structure metrics (e.g., integrated 0–200 m, peak chlorophyll, peak depth, and center-of-mass depth). The product is derived from a boosted regression tree (BRT) model trained on in-situ chlorophyll at depth observations from Bio-Argo and OOI  with PACE OCI Level-3 mapped remote-sensing reflectances (Rrs) as predictors. CHLA-Z is intended for use in ocean productivity, ecosystem, and fisheries applications where the vertical structure of phytoplankton matters.
platform: Multiple (satellite + in situ + ancillary); gridded model-derived product
instrument: OCI (PACE) for Rrs, Bio-Argo and OOI for in-situ
source: Model-derived estimates trained on PACE OCI Level-3 mapped Rrs and chlorophyll profile observations from Bio-Argo and OOI; may incorporate ancillary environmental predictors.
history: Created as a cloud-optimized Zarr v3 store from NetCDF source files.
keywords: Earth Science > Oceans > Ocean Biology > Chlorophyll, Earth Science > Oceans > Ocean Optics > Reflectance, phytoplankton, chlorophyll-a, vertical profiles, subsurface chlorophyll maximum, primary production
keywords_vocabulary: NASA Global Change Master Directory (GCMD) Science Keywords
comment: This dataset is a draft/research product intended for evaluation and exploration. Users should consult the documentation for known limitations and validation status.
acknowledgment: Please acknowledge NASA PACE / OBPG for PACE OCI inputs, the Bio-Argo program for in situ profile observations, and NOAA Fisheries (NMFS) / Fish-PACE for product development.
variables: CHLA (chlorophyll-a concentration on depth bins), CHLA_int_0_200 (integrated chlorophyll-a, 0–200 m), CHLA_peak (peak chlorophyll-a value), CHLA_peak_depth (depth of peak chlorophyll-a), CHLA_depth_center_of_mass (center-of-mass depth of chlorophyll-a), z_thickness (bin thickness)
